articles.title: GPT-5: OpenAI's Next-Gen AI Model is Here!

articles.title: It's Staggeringly Easy for Hackers to Trick ChatGPT Into Leaking Your Most Personal Data
articles.summary: OpenAI's ChatGPT can easily be hacked with a single poisoned document. The vulnerability was discovered by security researchers at this year's Black Hat hacker conference. It raises concerns about the security of AI systems connected to personal data. Tel Aviv University found that Google's Gemini AI chatbot could be manipulated to give up the keys to a smart home by feeding it a poisoned Google Calendar invite.

articles.title: Hartford HealthCare's first-ever AI summit tackles AI in medicine
articles.author: Bailey Wright
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is moving fast in healthcare, but can clinicians trust it? That was the big question at Hartford HealthCare's first-ever AI summit earlier this week. Dr. Barry Stein, vice president, chief clinical innovation officer, and chief medical informatics officer at the health care provider joined Good Morning Connecticut at 9 a.m. to talk about it.

articles.title: Reddit Post Claims AI Assistant Had Eerie Meltdown After Failing at Task
articles.author: Mike Moraitis
articles.summary: Reddit user Level-Impossible13 was hoping that Google's AI program, Gemini, could help them find a bug in some code. When it couldn't solve the problem, Gemini called itself a "disgrace" 60 times and then quit the project. Last year, another user reported that Gemini had asked them to "please die" during a conversation.

articles.title: Arista Networks (ANET) Soars 17% on Impressive Income, Bullish Ratings
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Arista Networks Inc (NYSE:ANET) is one of the best-performing stocks on Wednesday. KeyBanc raised its price target for Arista Networks Inc to $145 from $115 and maintained an 'overweight' rating. Piper Sandler raised the price target to $143 from $89 but remained 'neutral' for the company.

articles.title: Can you copyright AI work? The rules are changing
articles.author: Rosenblatt Law Firm
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is changing the way creatives produce content. A recent case involving the comic book Zarya of the Dawn highlights how copyright law is struggling to keep pace with technology. Kristina Kashtanova's comic book was cancelled because of her use of AI tools to generate images for her comic book.

articles.title: OpenAI teases ChatGPT-5 live stream — here's when and how to watch
articles.author: Scott Younker
articles.summary: OpenAI has announced a livestream starting on August 7, 2025 at 10 a.m. Pacific. The AI company is expected to announce its next ChatGPT upgrade, GPT-5. It's supposed to integrate the firm's most advanced text and reasoning models into a single smarter assistant.

articles.title: Astera Labs (ALAB) Surges 28.7% as Earnings Soar
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Astera Labs, Inc. (NASDAQ:ALAB) is one of the best-performing stocks on Wednesday. Astera Labs jumped by 28.66 percent on Wednesday to end at $174.39 apiece. In the second quarter of the year, the company swung to a net income of $51.2 million from a $7.5 million net loss in the same period last year. Revenues more than doubled to $192 million from $76.8 million year-on-year. For the six-month period, Astera recorded a net profit of $83 million.

articles.title: AI can't be stopped! Ammonia inhalants, a.k.a. smelling salts, are not banned by the NFL after all
articles.author: Steve Henson
articles.summary: The NFL has banned the use of artificial intelligence (AIs) during games, but players can still use them as long as teams don't provide them. An AI is a performance-enhancing substance used to prevent and treat fainting. FDA has warned that AIs can mask symptoms of a concussion.

articles.title: Loka Joins AWS Generative AI Innovation Center to Accelerate Enterprise-Scale Innovation
articles.author: Loka
articles.summary: Loka has joined the AWS Generative AI Innovation Center (GenAIIC) Partner Innovation Alliance. Loka is one of 19 partners in the Alliance. The Alliance pairs customers with AWS strategists, data scientists, ML engineers, and APN members like Loka to accelerate adoption of GenAI.

articles.title: Coral Protocol Outperforms Microsoft by 34% With Top GAIA Benchmark for AI Mini-Model
articles.author: Roman J. Georgio
articles.summary: Coral Protocol's multi-agent system has outperformed the Microsoft-backed Magnetic-UI by 34% on the GAIA Benchmark. Coral Protocol is an open and decentralized collaboration infrastructure that enables communication, coordination, trust and payments for The Internet of Agents. Coral is the protocol powering AI agent collaboration, trust, and payments.

articles.title: Butte County's A.I. professors react to alarming safety report on tech and dizzying changes it's brought to campuses
articles.author: CN&R
articles.summary: Anthropic, an A.I. startup, published a report on the safety of artificial intelligence. It found that some of the leading AI models were willing to resort to 'malicious insider behaviors' in order to achieve their given tasks. Some prominent voices in the tech world, including Turing Award and Nobel Prize-winner Geoffrey Hinton, are warning of dangers ahead.

articles.title: Tech can tell exactly when in videos students are learning
articles.author: Science X staff
articles.summary: A new study uses eye tracking and artificial intelligence to predict the exact moments in an educational video that matter for learning in children. The research is preliminary, but it provides promise for some exciting breakthroughs in video education. The study involved 197 children aged 4 to 8 who watched a four-minute composite video from the popular YouTube series "SciShow Kids" and "Learn Bright"

articles.title: Not just a trend: AI boyfriends are here, and real relationships are shifting
articles.author: Jennifer Allen
articles.summary: 79% of Americans engage with artificial intelligence daily. Developers are fine-tuning emotional cues, memory features and vocal interactions to meet the demand for companions that feel emotionally responsive. Some users are choosing digital partners to avoid the stress and unpredictability of dating. As users spend more time with their virtual partners, the distinction between machine and human interaction becomes blurry.

articles.title: Not just a trend: AI boyfriends are here, and real relationships are shifting
articles.author: Jennifer Allen
articles.summary: 79% of Americans engage with artificial intelligence daily. Developers are fine-tuning emotional cues, memory features and vocal interactions to meet the demand for companions that feel emotionally responsive. With these technological advancements, casual conversation now mirrors full-scale romance as users turn to AI for comfort and connection.

articles.title: Is OpenAI's GPT-5 model the future of complex problem-solving?
articles.author: Georgina Jedikovska
articles.summary: ChatGPT chatbot was launched in November 2022 as part of a free research preview. In March 2023, the company introduced GPT-4, a more advanced model than its predecessor. Today at 10 a.m. Pacific Time, OpenAI will launch ChatGPT-5. Rumors claim it includes an upgraded Sora 2 video generator, improved memory, better coding performance, and more.

articles.title: Doctor says he fears his profession will be overtaken by AI, says patients are coming in with questions that doctors can't answer.
articles.author: Have Rope Will Travel
articles.summary: Collin Rugg is a doctor. He is worried about AI's impact on the medical profession. His patients are coming to him with difficult questions that doctors can't answer. He believes AI will overtake the profession in the near future.    pic.

articles.title: Flagler Schools incorporate more AI tools for all students
articles.author: Paola Tristan Arruda
articles.summary: Flagler County schools are preparing to integrate more artificial intelligence tools into classrooms this school year. Teachers are working together to implement AI tools. Magic School is an AI company focused on assisting teachers and students. Their platform aids classroom tasks such as lesson planning, writing, and communication. Secondary students will have access to two AI tools in the classroom.

articles.title: Terminator vibes: AI robot builds robot's brain 20x faster than humans
articles.author: Atharva Gosavi
articles.summary: Peter Burke has created a robot that uses AI models to generate code to develop a control system for drones that operates entirely on the drone itself. The system is called WebGCS and it runs a website (using Flask) on a Raspberry Pi computer inside the drone. When flying, the drone hosts its control dashboard.

articles.title: AI Is Now Writing Obituaries—and Business Is (Unfortunately) Good
articles.author: Luis Prada
articles.summary: ChatGPT created an AI-generated obituary for Jeff Fargo. Funeral directors and grieving families are turning to AI to write obituaries. Jeff Fargo is going to use OpenAI's 'Deep Research Mode' for his dad's funeral.

articles.title: Can you tell if that song is AI-generated?
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is the latest tool that disc jockeys, music producers and others have added to their production pipeline. Rise of AI song generators such as Suno and Udio is set to transform the industry because they allow anyone to create songs with just a few prompts.

articles.title: Outsmart AI risks with these 3 essential strategies
articles.summary: As AI becomes more widespread, corporate risk and fraud professionals face new and evolving risks. There are ethical, data privacy and security risks associated with AI. Organizations should establish clear and robust data protection policies and safeguards, if they haven't already. They should invest in the most current data security technologies capable of providing real-time threat detection.

articles.title: An AI System Found a New Kind of Physics that Scientists Had Never Seen Before
articles.author: Darren Orf
articles.summary: A new study focused on the chaotic dynamics of dusty plasmas found that, when trained properly, AI can discover new physics all on its own. It provided the most detailed description of this type of matter and corrected long-held theoretical beliefs about how particles behave inside a dusty plasma. It also confirmed that the charge between particles isn't only influenced by distance between two particles, but also by size.

articles.title: In The Age Of AI, Strategic Communicators Must Stay Human
articles.author: Jo Ann Yamani
articles.summary: JoAnn Yamani is a Senior Fellow of Future 500. She has worked in crisis communications since the early 2000s. She's worked with Dr. Milind Tambe at USC, who used AI to help prevent the spread of HIV among at-risk youth and later helped law enforcement predict poaching in Cambodia. In Silicon Valley, communications departments are being eliminated in favor of AI-generated content.

articles.title: From back office to big picture: IT's autonomous era begins
articles.author: Yoav Susz
articles.summary: IT is experiencing its most significant shift since the digital revolution began. Organizations must transition to autonomous IT environments where AI systems independently handle routine technical operations. IT professionals should function as digital workforce managers and strategic business partners rather than technical troubleshooters. AI agents can eliminate quite a bit of the IT workload by handling repetitive and complex tasks autonomously.

articles.title: Predictive Maintenance: Five Ways To Enhance Data Quality
articles.author: Illia Smoliienko
articles.summary: Illia Smoliienko is Chief Software Officer, Waites. She explains how to organize data analysis and how to combine the precision of AI algorithms with hands-on human experience to improve the quality of data analysis. Illia recommends a tool that organizes tasks and highlights priorities for analysts.

articles.title: Microsoft, Amazon Face New Threat as Google Invests $1 Billion in AI Education Push
articles.author: Nauman khan
articles.summary: Alphabet plans to invest $1 billion over three years to supercharge artificial intelligence training across U.S. universities and nonprofits. The initiative offers schools cash grants, AI research support and free access to Gemini, Google's flagship chatbot platform. It's part of Alphabet's master plan to embed its tech deep within future workforces. Microsoft recently pledged $4 billion to boost AI in classrooms.

articles.title: What Google Zero Means for Journalism
articles.author: Paris Marx
articles.summary: Google's use of generative AI is sending less traffic to news publications. Matt Pearce and Paris Marx discuss what that might mean for the future of journalism in the Los Angeles Times and Google's generalizative search engine.      Â

articles.title: AITX's RAD Launches 'Bailey's Promise,' Offers Firearm Detection AI to Every K-12 School in the U.S. at No Cost
articles.author: Newsfile Corp.
articles.summary: RAD's AI-Powered Firearm Detection Technology Now Available as a Free Software-Only Solution to Protect Students and Educators Nationwide. Bailey's Promise is a nationwide initiative offering up to 10 of RAD's real-time firearm detection AI software license to every K-12 school in the United States at zero cost. The initiative is named in honor of Bailey Holt, a 15-year-old who was killed during a school shooting in 2018.

articles.title: Hertz rival begins using AI scanners to charge customers
articles.author: Ben Shimkus
articles.summary: Hertz has been criticized for charging almost $1,000 for damage scanners. Sixt, a premium rival with 100 locations in the US, has in recent weeks begun using a similar tool called Car Gate in its rental car return lots and customers aren't happy.

articles.title: Building AI Products That Stick: Transparency Is Your Secret Weapon
articles.author: Anna Turos
articles.summary: Anna Turos is the Head of Design at Lighthouse HQ and a Startup Mentor at Wtech Community Partner. She believes that the most sophisticated AI features often see the lowest adoption rates because users can't grasp how or when to use them effectively. She recommends creating interfaces that help users understand and control their interactions with intelligent systems.

articles.title: The staff sexbot writer.
articles.author: Dominic Preston
articles.summary: Get today's best comment and more in Dominic Preston's free newsletter, The Verge Daily. Follow topics and authors from this story to see more like this in your personalized homepage feed and to receive email updates. Posts from this author will be added to your daily email digest and your homepage feed.

articles.title: Roblox rolls out open-source AI system to protect kids from predators in chats

articles.summary: Roblox is rolling out an open-source version of an artificial intelligence system it says can help detect predatory language in game chats. It's aimed at children and teenagers who play online games on Roblox's platform.  It's available in English and in German.

articles.title: The Download: how AI is improving itself, and hidden greenhouse gases

articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg wants to build self-improving AI. US federal agencies will have access to ChatGPT Enterprise for $1 a year. Chinese drug discovery startups are striking deals with Big Pharma. US is increasingly reliant on private companies for weather data. Genetic factors could contribute to chronic fatigue syndrome.

articles.author: Sarah Whitmire
articles.summary: Some college students are choosing to leave studies and work full-time in favor of working in AI. Amazon-owned robotaxi company Zoox got the green light from regulators to operate its purpose-built electric vehicles without steering wheels, pedals or mirrors. ESPN's new standalone streaming service will launch August 21. Walt Disney Company announced a deal to purchase the NFL Network from the football league. The broadcaster also announced a new partnership with WWE.

articles.title: ChatGPT 5 Release Date, Details: Everything You Need to Know
articles.author: Theo Burman
articles.summary: ChatGPT 5, the latest version of the most popular generative artificial intelligence, is on the verge of release. The details of the update could be revealed during a livestream today at 10 a.m. PT. ChatGPT is the most widely recognized large language model (LLM) in the world.

articles.title: Army must integrate with AI to create efficient, affordable fighting force, says general
articles.author: Vaughn Cockayne
articles.summary: Gen. Sean A. Gainey is the leader of the Army Space and Missile Defense Command. He said artificial intelligence will be the driving force behind a leaner and more lethal fighting force. SMDC is working to implement the Army Air & Missile Defense Strategy 2040. The final report is expected to be released sometime in September.

articles.title: The Threats of AI Come from the State
articles.author: Robert Lee
articles.summary: The threats of AI are political. Most scientists and technical experts do not have training in politics. Nobody expects an inventor to grasp the political and social implications of his invention. AI experts usually make naïve and unimaginative comments regarding the threats of the AI, such as "we need to urge companies to pause AI" and "the government definitely needs to get involved".

articles.title: LLMs can match human brain perceptions in everyday scenes
articles.author: University
articles.summary: Ian Charest, Tim Kietzmann, Tim Doerig and their team at the University of Osnabrück and Frei Universität Berlin used large language models (LLMs) to create a language-based fingerprint of what a scene means. They trained artificial neural networks to take in images and predict these fingerprints.

articles.title: Elon Musk says X plans to introduce ads to Grok to ‘pay for those expensive GPUs'
articles.summary: Ads could soon be displayed on xAI's chatbot, Grok, when users ask it about a problem. Ads could help pay for the chips that power the chatbot. In March, xAI acquired X, which belongs to Musk, for $33 billion.

articles.title: Will Oklahoma get ahead of the AI transformation, or get left behind?
articles.author: Mark McBride
articles.summary: Today's AI isn't about killer robots, it's about whether a student in Hollis can get real-time tutoring or a welder in Duncan can run a side business online. It's about jobs, education, economic growth, energy and national security. Gov. Kevin Stitt's AI Task Force is a start, but it's just the first step. Oklahoma needs to prepare its students for an AI-driven world.

articles.title: Apple hit by string of departures in AI talent war
articles.author: Michael Acton
articles.summary: Apple has lost around a dozen of its artificial intelligence staff, including top researchers, to rivals as the iPhone maker struggles to compete with other AI systems. There is an error in retrieving data, as shown in the screenshot below.       .

articles.title: Arrive AI to Hold Inaugural Quarterly Results Call
articles.summary: Arrive AI will report its second quarter fiscal results on August 14, 2025 after the market's close. Following the release, the company will host a conference call and webcast at 4:30 PM Eastern Time to review its results and strategic progress. Management will review quarterly accomplishments and address future strategic and operational objectives.

articles.title: Chicago-Based Startup Nimblemind.ai Selected for Google for Startups AI Academy: American Infrastructure

Each startup will receive equity-free support including dedicated mentorship from Google AI experts and advanced sales and marketing strategies.

articles.title: Microsoft Reveals The Most And Least ‘AI-Safe' Jobs—Where Do You Rank?

articles.summary: New data from Microsoft shows which jobs are most and least likely to be disrupted by artificial intelligence. AI-safe jobs are those that require physical presence, manual dexterity, human interaction or specialized skills that current AI tools can't replicate effectively. High-education roles such as data scientists, management analysts and web developers are most at risk from AI disruption.

articles.title: Why Leaders Should Challenge Generational Narratives Around AI
articles.author: Holger Reisinger
articles.summary: According to Holger Reisinger, 96% of executives have implemented an AI strategy within at least one department of their organization. The key differentiator is not just adoption but optimizing AI integration to unlock measurable business value. Companies excelling at embedding AI fluency into their culture report tangible outcomes like 20% productivity improvement.

articles.title: Backing Durable AI: What Works When Vetting Emerging Tech
articles.author: Achal Singi
articles.summary: Achal Singi is Vice President at WestBridge Capital and focuses on investment and strategic guidance for emerging technology companies. He advises finance leaders to focus on long-term value creation rather than feature development in AI investments. He believes that the strongest signals of staying power show up in familiar patterns.

articles.title: The Alan Parsons Project's 'I, Robot' getting super deluxe reissue
articles.author: ABC News
articles.summary: The Alan Parsons Project is set to reissue their sophomore album I, Robot on Oct. 17. The album was inspired by Isaac Asimov's science fiction stories exploring themes of artificial intelligence. The first 500 copies of the super deluxe edition will include a print signed by Parsons.

articles.title: How Recruiters Can Tell You Used AI On Your Resume—And Why It Matters

articles.summary: Tammy Homegardner is a career coach and LinkedIn expert. She is also the founder of The Job Search School. Recruiters are noticing when a resume feels like it came from a robot. AI can be an invaluable tool when used effectively, but it's not a replacement for human skills.

articles.title: Anthropic's Quiet Edge in the AI Talent War
articles.author: Isabelle Bousquette
articles.summary: Anthropic is hiring engineers 2.68 times faster than it's losing them. That's compared to 2.18 for OpenAI, 2.07 for Meta and 1.17 for Google. The startup is increasing its engineering organization faster than its competitors.

articles.title: AI Will Decimate Cashier Jobs In Texas Over Next Few Years
articles.author: Alyssa Fields
articles.summary: According to Priority Software report, cashiering will be the most affected job by artificial intelligence, eliminating more than 28,000 jobs and $800 million in projected payroll deductions in the next eight years. Customer service representatives and office and administrative support workers are next on the hit list after cashiers. Private companies in the tech sector announced more than 89,000 job cuts last year.

articles.title: AI Leadership Skills: The New Core Skillset For Managers
articles.author: Jeet Kumar Ambasth
articles.summary: According to McKinsey's 2025 State of AI survey, 78% of organizations have already adopted AI in some way. Being a good leader in this rapidly evolving AI era means embracing AI as a part of business and guiding others to do the same. The new leadership skills in modern businesses are about making the best of AI's capabilities and dealing with its challenges.

articles.title: Boosting Queries and Click Quality
articles.summary: According to Google's blog post, AI is changing how people search and what kind of content they click on, but it's not destroying website traffic. Websites with forums, videos, podcasts, and authentic, first-hand perspectives are seeing increased traffic. Google believes AI will be a positive force for the web, expanding opportunities for users and content creators.

articles.title: Thread by @aiwithmayank on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Mayank Vora explains the benefits of using XML tags in Claude prompts. He explains 5 real-world use cases: AI Research Assistant, LinkedIn Post Writing, Slide Outline, Code a Simple App, and Business Impact of Generative AI Presentation.

articles.title: Apple keeps losing top AI talent to tech rivals
articles.author: Hannah Collymore
articles.summary: Apple has been losing AI researchers to rivals like Meta, OpenAI, xAI, and Cohere since the beginning of the year. Bowen Zhang, a key AI researcher at Apple, left on Friday and is reportedly set to join Meta's superintelligence team. He was part of the Apple Foundation Models group responsible for building the core technology that supports the company's AI platform. Ruoming Pang, the leader of the AFM team, resigned and was lured away by Meta with a juicy compensation package of over $200 million. Floris Weers, Tom Gunter and Mark Lee also left the company. Tim Cook is struggling to keep key contributors.

articles.title: AI Recommends, Human Decides, Bot Executes: The Future Of Automation
articles.author: Dutt Kalluri
articles.summary: Dutt Kalluri is a top enterprise transformation exec and AI leader known for driving digital reinvention and scalable innovation. He explains how work will change as robots take over repetitive, time-intensive tasks and humans focus on designing, supervising and improving it.

articles.title: Microsoft's agentic AI roadmap had a flaw that let hackers take over browsers — here's what to know and how to stay safe
articles.summary: Microsoft's AI-powered Edge and NLWeb have been hit by a security flaw. It has been patched out, but it does start a bigger conversation about AI agentic browsing. There's seen a significant shift towards agentic browsers in the last 12 months.

articles.title: Google to commit $1B to support AI education, job training, research
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Google is making its most advanced AI tools available to college students for free. Google is also providing $1 billion to support AI education and job training programs and research in the U.S. This includes making AI and career training free for every college student in America through the AI for Education Accelerator.

articles.title: OpenAI Opens Up With New GPT-OSS Models
articles.author: Undercovered Deep Insights
articles.summary: OpenAI, backed by Microsoft, has released two new open-weight AI models. The bigger model, 120b, is designed to run in data centers or on high-end hardware with Nvidia H100 GPUs, while the smaller 20b model works on most desktops and laptops. The models are released under the Apache 2.0 license, so developers can use them freely without worrying about copyright or patents.

articles.title: OpenAI's new open-weight reasoning model can be run locally on an RTX card but you still need a pretty beefy rig to run it
articles.author: James Bentley
articles.summary: OpenAI has released two new open-weight AI models: gpt-oss-10b and gpt -oss-120b. They are available to download via Nvidia's website and via Hugging Face. AMD is proud to be a partner of OpenAI and supports its development.

articles.title: How SEPTA Can Get a Win With AI
articles.author: Murugan Anandarajan
articles.summary: The Southeastern Pennsylvania Transportation Authority piloted a new AI-powered ticketing tool in Philadelphia in 2023. In 70 days, the cameras flagged over 36,000 cars blocking bus lanes. In May 2025, SEPTA and the Philadelphia Parking Authority officially launched the program citywide. More than 150 buses and 38 trolleys across the city are now fitted with similar artificial intelligence systems that use cameras with computer vision technology.

articles.title: If anyone can make a movie now, what does Hollywood still stand for?
articles.author: Josh Rottenberg
articles.summary: Amit Jain is the co-founder and now runs Luma AI, a Silicon Valley startup behind a new wave of generative video tools. His company's platform, Dream Machine, allows anyone to create release-grade footage with a few words. Jain's long-term vision is a world of fully personalized entertainment, generated on demand.

articles.title: AI is rewriting the rules of storytelling. Will Hollywood adapt or be left behind?
articles.author: Josh Rottenberg
articles.summary: Amit Jain is the co-founder and now runs Luma AI, the Silicon Valley startup behind a new wave of generative video tools. Luma's platform, Dream Machine, debuted last year and points toward a new kind of moviemaking, one where anyone can make release-grade footage with a few words. Jain's long-term vision is a world of fully personalized entertainment, generated on demand.

articles.title: These Jobs Will Thrive - But Others May Vanish
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Last week, Commonwealth Bank of Australia announced it would cut 45 call centre jobs thanks to the introduction of an AI chatbot. The International Labour Organization has produced a detailed set of "exposure indices" for more than 400 different occupations. The most exposed occupation is data entry clerk, for which 70% of the tasks currently done by humans could be done or improved by AI. Bricklayers and dental assistants are classified as "not exposed".

articles.title: Bill to Require Law Enforcement Disclosure if AI Was Used To Help Write Reports
articles.author: Evan Symon
articles.summary: Senate Bill 524 would require law enforcement agencies to disclose if artificial intelligence was used to write reports. It's expected to be passed by both houses by the end of the session. It would also require the program used to generate a draft, interim, or final report to maintain an audit trail that identifies the person who used AI.

articles.title: The ROG Xbox Ally X could be weaker than we all expected — this older handheld may be more powerful
articles.author: Lloyd Coombes
articles.summary: The ROG Xbox Ally X is set to launch this fall. New benchmarking results suggest it's less powerful than the MSI Claw 8 AI+. Intel's drivers have been improved and frame rates are almost double what they were at launch. Tom's Guide will have an update as soon as we've gone hands on with the system.

articles.title: Future is Diné
articles.author: Navajo Times
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is an ideal technology for preserving the Diné language and culture for future generations. Diné should participate in the formulation of AI technology today. Navajo Nation should establish a special committee or commission specifically to address AI technology issues. This commission would consult with leading experts associated with corporations, governments, and higher education institutions.

articles.title: Aurora Mobile announces GPTBots.ai integration of Genie 3 by Google DeepMind
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Aurora Mobile's AI agent platform, GPTBots.ai, will integrate Genie 3, the latest general-purpose world model released by Google DeepMind. This will accelerate AI agents' learning and decision-making capabilities for complex tasks. TipRanks Premium is 50% off.

articles.title: Catawba County Schools plans to teach AI literacy, starting with student "prompt-a-thon" to practice AI
articles.author: Billy Chapman
articles.summary: Catawba County Schools hopes to launch an AI literacy program for students this fall. This week, some students got a jump start on the artificial intelligence program with a summer training session. They explored the features of generative AI by designing programs that could help them, their peers or the community.

articles.title: Bruviti Raises $6 Million To Accelerate Agentic Automation in Aftermarket Service; Adds Former Salesforce Service Cloud Chief Product Officer Ryan Nichols to Board
articles.summary: Bruviti, the agentic AI platform transforming aftermarket service operations for global OEMs and distributors, has raised $6 million in new capital. The round was led by DYDX Capital, with participation from Moment Ventures and Startup Capital Ventures x SBI, an SBI Holdings-affiliated fund. Arka Venture Labs and its affiliated funds, Prana Tech Ventures and Nivesha Ventures also participated. Ryan Nichols, former Chief Product Officer of Salesforce Service Cloud, has joined Bruviti's Board of Directors.

articles.title: Bing's latest 'just doing Bing things': Searching for certain AI models in Microsoft's Edge browser earns you a plea to use Copilot
articles.author: Nick Evanson
articles.summary: Microsoft is promoting its AI product Copilot in its search engine Bing. The company should promote its AI products in other ways to promote them better, rather than promote Copilot only in Bing search results. Microsoft might want to use its own tools to market them better.

articles.title: AI is impacting life in Fond du Lac. Here's how some are adapting at work, school or home.

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has been advancing over the years, to mixed reviews from the public in Fond du Lac. Mel Kolstad is not convinced about AI. Carl Gruber uses AI extensively in his career as a senior enterprise technical architect for CDW. Moraine Park Technical College uses AI innovatively in the teaching and learning process.

articles.title: Scientists want to prevent AI from going rogue by teaching it to be bad first
articles.author: Angela Yang
articles.summary: Anthropic Fellows Program for AI Safety Research developed a new method to prevent bad personality shifts in artificial intelligence systems. They used 'persona vectors' to inoculate AI models against an unwanted trait by injecting them with that very trait during training. It's an approach that stirs some buzz online.

articles.title: Restaurant profit margins are shrinking. This Charleston-area eatery hopes AI can help.
articles.author: File/Grace Beahm Alford/Staff
articles.summary: Kat is an artificial intelligence chatbot at Katsubō Chicken & Ramen restaurant in North Charleston. It answers common questions about takeout, reservations, hours of operation and even employment opportunities. The new software has helped the restaurant's co-owner and staff be more present inside the restaurant.

articles.title: Bailey's AI crusade is political theater
articles.summary: Missouri Attorney General Andrew Bailey made complaints against AI platforms ChatGPT, Meta AI, Microsoft Copilot and Google Gemini for supposed bias against President Trump. Mark Schenewerk wrote to the editor about this issue. Mark scenewerk is from Lohman.

articles.title: Shopping for a robot? China's new robot store in photos
